channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Eruption survivors threaten to sue White Island Tours
item.description: A lawyer representing Australian victims of the Whakaari/White Island disaster says they are exploring legal action against White Island Tours.

item.title: Imagining decolonisation in Aotearoa
item.description: What does decolonisation mean and how does the concept inspire Māori and Pākehā New Zealanders' vision for Aotearoa?

item.title: Illegal status of cannabis 'acts as a barrier to getting support'- researcher
item.description: The risks of developing psychosis after cannabis use are significant for teens, but if it was legalised it would make it easier to teach them about the risks, says the director of NZ's longest running study.

item.title: 'There's a lot of hope and promise to cure food allergies'
item.description: Many food allergies could be cured, possibly permanently, by retraining the immune system, says allergy expert Dr Kari Nadeau.

item.title: Jetstar should offer refunds for cancelled flights - Consumer NZ
item.description: Consumer New Zealand believes Jetstar should not have taken some bookings for flights it is now cancelling.

item.title: Surprise donation a boost for South Island eco-sanctuary
item.description: The operator of an eco-sanctuary in Golden Bay said a large surprise donation would allow it to advance critical conservation plans.

item.title: Covid-19: No new cases for 15th day in a row
item.description: There are no new cases of covid-19 in New Zealand for the 15th consecutive day, with just one active case remaining.

item.title: 'Welcome home': greeting eases tension after long stay in India
item.description: A New Zealander who arrived home on a repatriation flight from Delhi says he was overwhelmed by the warm welcome at the airport.

item.title: MSD asked to mind accuracy, quality assurance after redundancy pay error
item.description: The Ministry of Social Development has been reprimanded for its treatment of redundancy payments when "practice did not reflect the policy".

item.title: Fundraiser for musicians: 'Without live music, our community is poorer'
item.description: Two small Hawke's Bay music venues are raising money to bring more musicians to the region, in a bid to support artists and the local music scene decimated by the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Snow falls in parts of Central Otago, warning for Crown Range
item.description: It's a wintry start to the weekend, with temperatures plummeting and snow falling in parts of the South, affecting roads and causing headaches for drivers on the Crown Range Rd.

item.title: Murder investigation launched after death of man in Hamilton
item.description: Police are seeking public help in a murder investigation, after a man died in Hamilton last night.

item.title: Dozens of heavy bells make Carillon high earthquake risk
item.description: The National War Memorial Carillon in central Wellington has been rated at just 15 percent of the earthquake code.

item.title: Seismic work at hospital disrupts $32m in improvements
item.description: Two major building projects at Hawke's Bay Hospital have been delayed by the discovery that seismic strengthening also needs to be carried out.

item.title: Birdlife, native bush set to benefit from biodiversity programme
item.description: Seventeen sites with regionally significant ecological values have been identified as new candidates for the Key Native Ecosystems programme in Taranaki, covering an area of more than 3000 hectares.

item.title: 'You sort of feel quite good': Displaced workers fell wilding pines
item.description: Hundreds of displaced Queenstown workers may be used to help tackle a growing pest problem - wilding pines.

item.title: Trans-Tasman travel 'crucial' for NZ tourism - Auckland Airport boss
item.description: Auckland Airport chief executive Adrian Littlewood wants a Trans-Tasman travel bubble on Cabinet's agenda when it meets on Monday.

item.title: Air NZ losing $5m a day, bracing for more job cuts - chief exec
item.description: Air New Zealand is losing $5 million a day and is bracing for potentially more job losses saying it needs to slash $150 million more from its wage bill.
